title: REVIEW  ---  Play:  News Quiz  ----  By Daniel Akst
text:
1. Colin Powell died at 84. Which of these wasn't among the posts he held?

A. Secretary of State

B. Secretary of Defense

C. Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff

D. National security advisor

---

2. Beset by electricity shortages, China is scrambling to boost coal production. How much of the world's supply does it consume?

A. A quarter

B. Half

C. Two thirds

D. Three quarters

---

3. With the help of a "Miyake event" in 993, scientists determined that Vikings settled North America as early as 1021. What's a Miyake event?

A. A trunk sale by a Japanese designer

B. A sun-darkening volcanic eruption resulting in tighter tree rings

C. A celestial incident that flooded the earth with carbon-14

D. The burial of a leader preserved well enough for soft-tissue dating

---

4. Spanx founder Sara Blakely is selling a majority stake -- to whom?

A. Maidenform

B. Nike

C. Blackstone

D. Tesla

---

5. To recruit talent, according to researchers, a ransomware gang allegedly pretended to be a real company -- called what?

A. Totally Legitimate Enterprises

B. Fortress Encryption

C. Data Shield LLC

D. Bastion Secure

---

6. Sexual desire among Americans is at a low ebb, a new study found. According to one psychologist, why?

A. "They're feeling really schlubby."

B. "They're worried about catching Covid."

C. "They've spent too much time together."

D. "They're aging out of sex."

---

7. Mawlawi Zubair Mutmaeen used to run Taliban suicide-bombing squads in Kabul. What's his Taliban job now?

A. Head of diversity, equity and inclusion

B. Commissioner of women's health

C. Police chief for a district of Kabul

D. Director of jihad operations

---

8. The invasive Joro spider, from Asia, is spreading fast across which state (and into others nearby)?

A. California

B. Georgia

C. New Jersey

D. Washington

---

ANSWERS

1. B

2. B

3. C

4. C

5. D

6. A

7. C

8. B
